question: Iran military response by Friday?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between August 10 and August 16, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

In the case that the "Yes" resolution criteria are met prior to this market's resolution date, this market will resolve immediately.

question: Will CeeDee Lamb be the top Fantasy Wide Reciever?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if CeeDee Lamb is the top-scoring wide receiver during the 2024 NFL season. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

This market will be based on ESPN’s FFL Points Per Reception (PPR) scoring, and refers to the totals for the entirety of the 2024-2025 NFL regular season.

In case of a tie for the most points scored, this market will resolve in favor of the player whose last name comes first alphabetically.

The resolution source for this market will be ESPN Fantasy https://fantasy.espn.com/football/leaders.

question: Will another player be the top Fantasy Running Back?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if any running back other than Christian McCaffrey, Bijan Robinson, Breece Hall, Jonathan Taylor, Jahmyr Gibbs, Saquon Barkley, Derrick Henry, Kyren Williams, Travis Etienne Jr., Isiah Pacheco, De’Von Achane, Josh Jacobs, or Alvin Kamara is the top scoring running back during the 2024 NFL season. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

This market will be based on ESPN’s FFL Points Per Reception (PPR) scoring, and refers to the totals for the entirety of the 2024-2025 NFL regular season.

In case of a tie for the most points scored, this market will resolve in favor of the player whose last name comes first alphabetically.

The resolution source for this market will be ESPN Fantasy https://fantasy.espn.com/football/leaders.

question: Will Manchester City win vs Chelsea?
description:
This market refers to the EPL match between Chelsea and Manchester City scheduled for August 18, 2024, 11:30 AM ET.

If Manchester City win the match this market will resolve to "Yes". Otherwise this market will resolve to "No". 

If the game is canceled or delayed beyond August 25, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market will be official information from the English Premier League.

events.title: EPL: Chelsea vs Man City
events.description: EPL Matchday 1: Chelsea vs Man City

question: Will Elon blame a foreign actor for Twitter crash?
description:
On August 12, 2024, Elon Musk claimed that a "massive" Distributed Denial of Service (DDOS) attack disrupted the social media platform X (formerly Twitter) during a scheduled interview with Donald Trump. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Elon Musk or X publicly blames a foreign actor or state for causing the disruption to the Trump interview by 11:59 PM ET on August 16, 2024. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

The accusation must be explicitly directed at a specific foreign entity or country. 

Accusations which are hedged are expressed with ambiguity (e.g. "We believe it was Iran") will qualify. However, purely speculative statements (e.g., "It could have been Iran") will not count.

The resolution source for this market will be official information from X (formerly Twitter) or public statements from Elon Musk.

The resolution source for this market will be official information from X (formerly Twitter) or public statements from Elon Musk.

question: Trump + Elon conversation over 2 hours long?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the conversation between Trump and Elon last longer than 2 hours (i.e. 2 hours, 0 minutes, 1 second or longer). Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

The start of the interview is defined as the first word from Elon (from when he first spoke in the conversation) up to the last word from Elon/Trump (whichever speaks last).

The resolution source will be a consensus of credible reporting.

events.title: Trump + Elon conversation over 2 hours long?
events.description:

question: Elon x Kamala Harris interview in August?
description:
On August 12, Elon Musk invited Kamala Harris to do an X space with him (see: https://x.com/elonmusk/status/1823217769229566251). 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Elon Musk interviews or holds a public X space with Kamala Harris by August 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

An announcement by either party that an interview/conversation will take place will not qualify for a "Yes" resolution. The interview must actually occur. 

The resolution source for this market will be the audio/video recording of the interview/conversation however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: Will RFK Jr. win <1% of the popular vote?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Robert F. Kennedy Jr. receives less than 1% of the popular vote in the 2024 U.S. presidential election. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

This market will resolve based off the official vote count once all States and D.C. have certified their votes.

question: Will RFK Jr. win 1-2% of the popular vote?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Robert F. Kennedy Jr. receives between 1% (inclusive) and 2% (exclusive) of the popular vote in the 2024 U.S. presidential election. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

This market will resolve based off the official vote count once all States and D.C. have certified their votes.

question: Will Arizona's abortion protection measure pass?
description:
The Arizona Proposition 139, Right to Abortion Initiative (2024), is set to be voted on during the November 5, 2024 US general elections. More information on this initiative can be found here: https://ballotpedia.org/Arizona_Proposition_139,_Right_to_Abortion_Initiative_(2024)

This market will resolve "Yes" if the Arizona Right to Abortion Initiative passes as a result of the vote scheduled for November 5, 2024. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be a consensus of credible media sources regarding this vote, however in case of ambiguity this market may remain open until official state results are released.

events.title: Which states will pass amendments protecting abortion?
events.description: This is a market group on whether the following states' amendments on abortion, scheduled to be voted on in the upcoming November 2024 election, will pass.

question: Will Sam LaPorta be the top Fantasy Tight End?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Sam LaPorta is the top scoring tight end during the 2024 NFL season. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

This market will be based on ESPN’s FFL Points Per Reception (PPR) scoring, and refers to the totals for the entirety of the 2024-2025 NFL regular season.

In case of a tie for the most points scored, this market will resolve in favor of the player whose last name comes first alphabetically.

The resolution source for this market will be ESPN Fantasy https://fantasy.espn.com/football/leaders.

question: Will Devin Strader win?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Devin Strader is announced as the winner of The Bachelorette Season 21. 

The winner is defined as the contestant who receives the final rose from the Bachelorette. Any changes in relationship status after the final rose ceremony including the "After the Final Rose" segment will not be considered. 

If no rose is given, or the finale ends without a final rose ceremony, this market will resolve to "No." 

If the final episode of the bachelorette is not publicly available by November 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No". 

The official resolution source will be the finale episode of The Bachelorette Season 21.

question: Real Madrid vs. Atalanta: UEFA Super Cup
description:
The market will resolve to "Real Madrid" if Real Madrid wins the UEFA Super Cup.

The market will resolve to "Atalanta" if Atalanta wins the UEFA Super Cup.

If the UEFA Super Cup has not been completed by August 21, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "50-50".

events.title: Real Madrid vs. Atalanta: UEFA Super Cup
events.description:
The market will resolve to "Real Madrid" if Real Madrid wins the UEFA Super Cup.

The market will resolve to "Atalanta" if Atalanta wins the UEFA Super Cup.

If the UEFA Super Cup has not been completed by August 21, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "50-50".

question: August temperature increase by less than 1.15°C?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the data for the Global Land-Ocean Temperature Index for August 2024 shows an increase of less than 1.15°C when it is released. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

An anomaly of less than 1.15°C for August 2024 is necessary and sufficient to resolve this market to "Yes" immediately once the data becomes available regardless of whether the figure for August 2024 is later revised.

The primary resolution source for this market will be the figure found in the table titled "GLOBAL Land-Ocean Temperature Index in 0.01 degrees Celsius" under the column "Aug" in the row "2024" (https://data.giss.nasa.gov/gistemp/tabledata_v4/GLB.Ts+dSST.txt). If NASA's "Global Temperature Index" is rendered permanently unavailable, other information from NASA may be used. If no information for August 2024 is provided by NASA by December 1, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve "Yes".

question: Will Missouri's abortion protection measure pass?
description:
The Missouri Right to Reproductive Freedom Amendment (2024), is set to be voted on during the November 5, 2024 US general elections. More information on this initiative can be found here: https://ballotpedia.org/Missouri_Right_to_Reproductive_Freedom_Amendment_(2024)

This market will resolve "Yes" if the Missouri Right to Reproductive Freedom Amendment passes as a result of the vote scheduled for November 5, 2024. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be a consensus of credible media sources regarding this vote, however in case of ambiguity this market may remain open until official state results are released.

events.title: Which states will pass amendments protecting abortion?
events.description: This is a market group on whether the following states' amendments on abortion, scheduled to be voted on in the upcoming November 2024 election, will pass.

question: August temperature increase by between 1.15-1.19°C?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the data for the Global Land-Ocean Temperature Index for August 2024 shows an increase of between 1.15°C (inclusive) and 1.19°C (inclusive) when it is released. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

An anomaly of between 1.15°C (inclusive) and 1.19°C (inclusive) August 2024 is necessary and sufficient to resolve this market to "Yes" immediately once the data becomes available regardless of whether the figure for August 2024 is later revised.

The primary resolution source for this market will be the figure found in the table titled "GLOBAL Land-Ocean Temperature Index in 0.01 degrees Celsius" under the column "Aug" in the row "2024" (https://data.giss.nasa.gov/gistemp/tabledata_v4/GLB.Ts+dSST.txt). If NASA's "Global Temperature Index" is rendered permanently unavailable, other information from NASA may be used. If no information for August 2024 is provided by NASA by December 1, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve "No".

question: Will Drake Maye start Week 1 for the Patriots?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Drake Maye is the starting quarterback for the New England Patriots in their Week 1 regular season game of the 2024 NFL season against the Cincinnati Bengals on September 9, 2024. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

If the Patriots do not name a single player as the starting quarterback, the market will resolve based on the player who takes the most snaps at quarterback during their first offensive drive of the game.

This market may not resolve before the start of the Patriots Week 1 regular season game. 

The resolution source for this market will be a consensus of credible reporting.

question: Will Russia capture Pokrovsk before November?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if, according to the ISW map, Russia captures St. Michael's church in Pokrovsk located on Hrushevskoho Vulytsia by October 31, 2024 at 11:59 PM ET.

The church will be considered captured if any part of building is shaded red on the ISW map (https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) by the resolution date. If the area is not shaded red by October 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve to “No”.

Once Russia captures the church, any subsequent loss of control will not be considered towards the resolution of this market.

Church Location: https://polymarket-upload.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/Pokrovsk+Church+Location.png

Pokrovsk Location: https://polymarket-upload.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/Pokrovosk+Location.png

Location on Google maps: https://www.google.com/maps/@48.2794472,37.1801207,592m/data=!3m1!1e3?entry=ttu

The primary resolution source for this market will be the ISW Ukraine map. If the ISW map is rendered unavailable, information from DeepStateMap (https://deepstatemap.live/) may be used. If information from both the ISW and DeepStateMap are rendered permanently unavailable, a consensus of credible reporting may be used.
